In order to compete with ambitious friends, the Griffins decide to climb Mount Everest.
When the Griffins are selected to have their TV-watching habits monitored, Peter hatches a scheme to control the airwaves.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Old Man and the Big 'C'
Episode.Overview: Brian learns that Carter Pewterschmidt's company is keeping the cure for cancer from the public in order to drive up profits; Quagmire reveals a secret.
When Brian accidentally causes Stewie's time machine to make reality run in reverse, the two must fix the problem before Stewie is unborn.
When the criminal who put Joe in the wheelchair becomes a fugitive, Quagmire, Joe and Peter try to hunt him down.

Episode.EpisodeName: Lois Comes Out of Her Shell
Episode.Overview: Peter tries to keep up with Lois as she goes through a midlife crisis; Stewie brings home a turtle from the park.
When Meg learns her crush is gay and interested in Chris, she uses her brother to get closer to him.
As the Griffin family is preparing for Christmas, Peter tells his own version of the Nativity story.
When the Griffins try to pick Chris up from space camp, they find themselves accidentally launched into space and reliant on Chris to get them home.
Brian writes a play that becomes a hit in Quahog, but loses his confidence when he finds that the play Stewie wrote is better than his.
During a visit to Harvard, Quagmire accidentally marries a prostitute; in an attempt to get out of his marriage, Quagmire pretends that Peter is his lover.
On Valentine's Day, Meg goes on a date with a guy she met online, and Lois and Peter stay in bed all day; Brian is visited by his ex-girlfriends.

When Meg catches Chris stealing money from Lois' purse, she makes him do her chores; Chris, tired of the pact with Meg, runs away to live with Herbert; Stewie and Brian become obsessed with singer Anne Murray.
When Lois gets a job at an adults-only phone line to earn extra money, she takes a call from Peter.
An unfortunate sky-diving accident sends Peter to the hospital, where he makes friends with a man named Mahmoud; Quagmire and Joe become suspicious of Mahmoud.
Mayor West becomes the prime suspect when a murder occurs at his mansion.

Episode.GuestStars: Max Charles, Wendy Schaal, Mike Judge, Bill Maher
Episode.Overview: When Peter resurfaces after being in a plane crash and lost in the wilderness for two months, his family must find a way to bring him back from his animal-like state.
When teddy bear Rupert is recalled, Stewie is determined to get his best friend back; when Peter is sick and can't compete in a bowling tournament, Lois fills in for him.

Episode.GuestStars: Tim Gunn, Christine Lakin, Emily Osment, Kevin Michael Richardson, Fred Tatasciore
Episode.Overview: Peter and the guys try to save The Drunken Clam from being closed after the bar's owner dies; Meg gets a job at a funeral home.
The Griffins move to a farm, where Peter starts a drug business.
Stewie's time machine malfunctions when he and Brian use it to travel to Las Vegas for a Bette Midler concert.

Episode.EpisodeName: No Country Club for Old Men
Episode.GuestStars: Hank Azaria|Nick Cannon|Sharon Osbourne|Tom Hiddleston|Emma Roberts
Episode.Overview:
When Chris make the acquaintance of the daughter of the owner of the Barrington Country Club, the Griffins are introduced to the new club lifestyle much to the chagrin of Carter.
Carter eventually gets kicked out of Barrington and Peter agrees to help him get back in.
Word that Peter believes a restaurant placemat is a treasure map pits the citizens of Quahog against each other as they search for the prize.

Peter discovers that he has a vestigial twin, whom he names Chip, growing out of his neck. It’s not long before Peter resents the fact that everyone seems to love Chip more than him, so he decides to amputate his twin. However, when Peter gets into trouble, he realizes he needs Chip more than ever.

When Quagmire meets a woman named Sonja who is as sexually insatiable as he is, he is thrilled to finally be with someone who won’t judge him. However, things take a turn for the worse when Sonja abducts Quagmire, intending to make him her sex slave. It is up to Peter, Joe and Quagmire’s dad to explore the seedy underbelly of Quahog to find and rescue Quagmire. Meanwhile, a love triangle emerges between Stewie, Brian and Stewie’s teddy bear, Rupert.
